snippet: Despite playing a large role in the protests that ousted President Hosni Mubarak, Egyptian women still face the restrictions of a patriarchal system.
abstract: Emboldened by the Egyptian revolution to claim a new voice in public life, many Egyptian women are finding that they are still dependent on the protection of men; Egyptian feminists had hoped for far greater power following the heady days of the revolution, when they played an active and equal role in bringing down a dictator.
lead_paragraph: Despite playing a large role in the protests that ousted President Hosni Mubarak, Egyptian women still face the restrictions of a patriarchal system.

headline.main: Egypt’s Women Find Power Still Hinges on Men
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Women Find Power Still Hinges on Men
